definition: to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including

sentences.english: Certain other expenses also may be deducted from taxable income, or one may elect to use the "standard deduction.
sentences.chinese: 某些其他支出也可從應繳納的個人收入稅中扣除。

sentences.english: Please subtract a quarter of the money for your own use.
sentences.chinese: 請扣除四分之一的錢由你自己支配使用。

sentences.english: Excluding the effects of one-time gains, operating losses were pared 32 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 扣除一次性收益影響，該業務營運虧損縮減32%。

sentences.english: That is roughly what will be deducted automatically from your account over the year.
sentences.chinese: 這大致就是每年自動從你帳戶中扣除的金額。

sentences.english: If the number reaches the ground, life will be deducted.
sentences.chinese: 數目字擊落地面則會被扣除生命。

sentences.english: The accounting office checked off each worker's dues every month.
sentences.chinese: 會計部門每月扣除每個工人的應繳費用。

sentences.english: The tempos of income refer to real tempo, The price factor is taken out.
sentences.chinese: 收入發展速度爲扣除物價因素後的實際發展速度。

sentences.english: They deducted the cost of the broken window from his allowance.
sentences.chinese: 他們從他的津貼中扣除損壞窗戶的費用。

sentences.english: Please re-issue new card to me & charge all handling fees incurred.
sentences.chinese: 請補發新卡予本人及扣除一切手續費。

sentences.english: We will deduct the premium from your commission of 5% payable to you.
sentences.chinese: 我們將從支付你方的百分之五的佣金中扣除保險費。

sentences.english: By increasing the amount of your deductible, your insurance premium goes down.
sentences.chinese: 通過增加你的扣除額，你的保費會下降。

sentences.english: After deducting operating expenses, the Fed transferred $47.4 billion to the Treasury.
sentences.chinese: 扣除經營費用後，美聯儲把474億美元轉移到庫房。

sentences.english: We request you to deduct our commission from the invoice.
sentences.chinese: 我們請求你方從發票中扣除我們的佣金。

sentences.english: Correction of the double deductions of Goths during a trade.
sentences.chinese: 修正了在交易戈司時的雙倍扣除額。

sentences.english: The brillant lawyer was known for his perspicacious deductions.
sentences.chinese: 燦爛的律師被稱爲他敏銳的扣除。

sentences.english: Other intangible assets for which no amortized expense may be calculated for deduction.
sentences.chinese: 其他不得計算攤銷費用扣除的無形資產。

definition: to set aside/to make provision for (capital requirements)
restitution/return of something to its original owner/remittance
to claim a credit against/tax reduction
